column4: I have a serious problem with my network settings on jaunty, how can I purge them and completely install them like the beginning?  I really hate the new jaunty network system
install wicd and laugh at all the suckers using network manager
is there any gui tool to work with network settings?
it seems as though they did away with network manager
it used to be nice, now it is a nightmere
is wicd easy, or is it going to hose my system?
well I haven't used anything but wicd in over a year now, it's superior to the way they were doing it
at this point I would try anything, thanks for the tip, installing now.
will this auto-replace my current messed up network manager?
I believe it will uninstall it
been over a year since I did it, I don't quite remember
it just dumped my applet, and seemingly disconnected me, but here I am. :)
how do I edit wicd, or get into it?
Applications->Internet
ahh, there it is, thanks
the best part is, once you have everything setup, it will do the network config before login, so you get network before you are even logged in
cool even got my dns stuff again
I think in hardy or intrepid it was simple and usable, either intrepid or juanty made a mess out of it, and took away the gui tools to fix things
I never liked that I didn't get network until after login, that's why I originally switched
I guess that didn't matter to me so much, just to be able to tinker and configure stuff was what I was lookng for.
!ff35 | derenrich
thanks for the tip on wicd, hopefully that will fix my issue, very easy and straight forward to use
np
